comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: This bandstand was first used as the pavillion to welcome the first Governor General of Australia, Lord Hopetoun, to Sydney when he landed at Farm Cove on 15 December 1901, as part of the Federation celebrations. See photograph at the National Library of Australia here: nla.gov.au/nla.pic-an24551979 It was recycled to be opened as a bandstand in Ashfield Park in 1903, and demolished due to decay in the 1940s (ref. www.ashfield.nsw.gov.au/pdf_files/ashfield_park.pdf)

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/lifeasdaddy] The NLA have the year wrong; it was December 1900, just before Federation - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/14353984 . Earlier photo at Farm Cove - [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/5494949425/]

comment._content: Right you are beachcomberaustralia. If you send NLA a note to correct it via their online form they will eventually fix the record.
